oai_dc:dc.dc:title: General Robert Macomb’s home on Spuyten Duyvil Creek, New York, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Exterior view of General Robert Macomb’s Home on Spuyten Duyvil Creek, New York. The property was “purchased by Alexander Macomb about 1789. Inherited by his grandson, Robert Macomb in 1810. [On] June 10, 1847 Wm. Foster, Jr.& Caroline Matilda Macomb married here. Sold in 1848 (Godwin, a Tavern), vacated 1917, razed 1920.” The notation on the verso of the photo cites the children of Wm. Foster Jr. and Caroline Matilda Macomb: Macomb George, Pell William, and Chauncey Charles Foster. These digital reproductions were scanned from the scrapbook of Mrs. Frank A. Wilk (Alva Herbert Wilk). 1 digital photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Foster family; Macomb family
